intro: Exomis microphylla var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved exomis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential medicinal properties.
